column4: I did apt-get install libapache2-mod-php5 mysql-server phpmyadmin, when I try to go to localhost/phpmyadmin it tries to download the page rather then loading in it... any help?
what do your apache logs tell you?
also, is your apache server running?  Do you get the apache test page at localhost?
yea
cool! now check your apache logs and see what the error is
php script is working got hello world to output
sorry to ask a lame question but do you know where the logs are located?
polite questions are not lame.  /var/log/apache or /var/log/apache2
caught SIGTERM, shutting down
Apache/2.0.55 (Ubuntu) PHP/5.1.6 configured -- resuming normal operations
that was all that was in error.log
pondering.....
I do not have apache installed on ubuntu, so I am not sure of the defaults.  Do you know your DocumentRoot?
on my non-ubuntu apache installation, DocRoot is /srv/www/htdocs.  phpmyadmin is located in /srv/www/htdocs/phpmyadmin.  Where is your phpmyadmin located?
un_operateur is on the right track
phpmyadmin works?
yea it just started working
didn't do anything to it
I've just been googling for a while
no I feel foolish lol, well thanx for trying to help me out
good.  all's well that ends well.  Do a little poking in your apache config.  You'll have an easier time on the next install.
